enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Juniors & Seniors
title: WCAS BUS_INST 394-0-29 Professional Linkage Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
*INFORMATION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE*


The instructor of "Positive Entrepreneurship" is: Gregg Latterman.


Positive Entrepreneurship: Profits and Meaning is a class consisting of nine classes/topics that will take students on a journey from where they are today to where they want to end up in their lifetime as successful positive entrepreneurs. The goal of this course is to help prepare students who want to start a company and live to their full potential in life both personally and professionally. The class will integrate entrepreneurship, Conscious Capitalism, and other related subjects to teach the skills and knowledge to enable students to build a life that matters through starting their own company. This class is the start of the student's journey to find meaning and true passion in their work and personal life.

subject: BUS_INST
